qas.question: What was the modern Conservative party created from?
Which party did the Whigs, along with others form?
In what year was the Tamworth manifesto introduced?
What was created by the modern Conservative Party in 1859 to define basic Conservative principles?
What event broke up the Liberal Party?
Why did the government led by Willian Ewart Gladstone collapse?

plausible_answers.text: set about assembling a new coalition of forces

qas.question: What did the PIttite Tories do after the Duke's government collapsed?
When did Lord Palmerston create the Pittite Tories?

context: The modern Conservative Party was created out of <a0_0>the 'Pittite' Tories<a0_0/> of <b8_0>the early 19th century<b8_0/>. In the late 1820s <b5_0>disputes over political reform<b5_0/> broke up this grouping. A government led by the Duke of Wellington collapsed <b6_0>amidst dire election results<b6_0/>. Following this disaster <a1_0>Robert Peel<a1_0/> <b7_0>set about assembling a new coalition of forces<b7_0/>. Peel issued the <b4_0>Tamworth Manifesto<b4_0/> in <a3_0>1834<a3_0/> which set out the basic principles of Conservatism; – the necessity in specific cases of reform in order to survive, but an opposition to unnecessary change, that could lead to "a perpetual vortex of agitation". Meanwhile, the Whigs, along with free trade Tory followers of Robert Peel, and independent Radicals, formed <a2_0>the Liberal Party<a2_0/> under Lord Palmerston in 1859, and transformed into a party of the growing urban middle-class, under the long leadership of William Ewart Gladstone.
